content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's an implementation of the `q_ands_a_extractor` function:

```julia
function q_ands_a_extractor(md)
    sections = md.split("\n\n") # Split markdown into question and answer sections
    answers = []
    for section in sections
        if starts_with?(section, "# Question")) # Check if current section is a question
            continue # Skip this question section
        elseif starts_with?(section, "# Answer"))) # Check if current section is an answer
            answers.append(section) # Add this answer section to the list of answers
            continue # Skip this answer section
        else # If current section doesn't match any of the above conditions
            warn("Invalid markdown format. Skipping this section...") # Warn user about invalid markdown format
            continue # Skip this section...
        end
    end # End for loop to iterate through all sections in markdown

    return (answers, md)) # Return tuple containing answers and markdown text
